qas.question: What subject is arguable concerning Tuvalu?
What was the amount of sea level change on Tuvalu estimated by the 2011 report?
What device was used to produce the measurements of sea level change on Tuvalu?
Prior to what year were the reports used to assess sea level rise?
What is assumed about the sea level reports and records of Tuvalu?

context: Whether there are measurable changes in the <a0_0>sea level<a0_0/> relative to the islands of Tuvalu is a contentious issue. There were problems associated with the <a3_0>pre-1993<a3_0/> sea level records from Funafuti which resulted in improvements in the recording technology to provide more reliable data for analysis. The <a4_0>degree of uncertainty<a4_0/> as to estimates of sea level change relative to the islands of Tuvalu was reflected in the conclusions made in 2002 from the available data. The 2011 report of the Pacific Climate Change Science Program published by the Australian Government, concludes: "The sea-level rise near Tuvalu measured by <a2_0>satellite<a2_0/> altimeters since 1993 is about <a1_0>5 mm<a1_0/> (0.2 in) per year."
